alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 4:31AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River from Dubuque downstream to Burlington affecting all of the counties bordering the Mississippi River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.1 feet, Basement flooding occurs in homes and businesses with seepage into yards in Savanna. Grain elevators are also affected. Water affects the lower portion of Marquette Parking lot. Water affects Vulcan and South Broad Streets in Sabula. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning and continue rising to 20.5 feet Thursday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. Safety information is available at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. The next statement will be issued late this morning.
